factsheet.heading: Bringing back life to the high street
paragraphs: Visit Little Mouse at 212A Selhurst Road, an Edwardian shop in South Norwood with original wooden frontage and fascia that is now an artisan cheesemonger.

On display within the shop will be an exhibition outlining the history of the shop explaining the architectural and social history and the fruition of restoring the frontage as funded in part by Croydon Council through Historic England's High Street Heritage Action Zone programme.
You will see the shopâ€™s historic fabric, showing clearly how the original 1850s building was remodelled in the 1900s.

There will be an exhibition showing the restoration journey of this beautiful historic building, a display of historic shop fronts in the area as well as an opportunity to chat with the shop owner who has used historical research to deliver the restoration project.
